SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
CastPlayChannelContext<FROM,TO>
Creates a channel context that casts the parent into the child.
Channel
A channel that can be registered with a platform.
ChildContextFinder<PARENT,CHILD>
Used for getting child context from a parent context.
ChildPlayChannelContext<PARENT,CHILD,PAYLOAD>
A channel context that wraps another channel context, extracting extra information from it.
ChildPlayContextDecoder<PARENT,CHILD,PAYLOAD>
Used for finding a child in a parent given the information in a payload.
ConfigChannel
A channel that can be used during the 'configuration' phase and that can be registered with a platform.
ConfigPayloadHandlingContext
Context used for applying a payload during the 'configuration' phase.
ConnectionConfigCallback
Callback for initiating configure tasks from the server during the 'configure' phase of player connection.
ConnectionConfigTask
Simplified version of ConfigurationTask.
ConnectionConfigTaskQueue
Used for enqueueing connection-configure tasks.
ContextEncoder<C,P>
Encodes context into a payload.
ContextualPlayChannel<C,P>
Describes a channel that sends and receives contextual payloads.
ContextualPlayPayloadHandler<C,P>
Handles a contextual payload.
DerivativeBufferSupplier<O,D>
Creates a derivative buffer using the original buffer's context information.
KNet
KNet xplat public interface.
KNetRegistrar
A wrapper around platform-specific registration methods that can be passed to common code for channel registration.
NetBuf<B>
Super-interface for all net buffers to make sure they have the same interface and implement the same methods.
NetBuf.SavedReaderIndex
Holds an index into a NetByteBuf that can be restored.
NetBufImplHelper
Utility class to help with implementing NetBuf.
NetBufs
Utility methods for working with KNet buffers.
NetByteBuf
Special FriendlyByteBuf class that provides methods specific to "offset" reading and writing - like writing a single bit to the stream, and auto-compacting it with similar bits into a single byte.
NetCodecs
NetBuf Codec utilities.
NetRegistryByteBuf
Special FriendlyByteBuf that is like a RegistryNetByteBuf but that extends RegistryFriendlyByteBuf instead of NetByteBuf.
NoContextChannel<P>
Interface for all no-context channels.
NoContextConfigChannel<P>
Describes a CustomPacketPayload channel that can have payloads sent and received during the 'configuration' phase.
NoContextConfigPayloadHandler<P>
Used for handling a payload.
NoContextPlayChannel<P>
Describes a CustomPacketPayload channel that can have payloads sent and received during the 'play' phase.
NoContextPlayPayloadHandler<P>
Used for handling a payload.
Palette<T>
Maps objects to integers, allowing for smaller packet sizes when the same objects are referenced multiple times.
ParentContextFinder<PARENT,CHILD>
Gets the parent context when given a child context.
PayloadConnection
Represents a connection capable of sending a payload to a receiver.
PayloadHandlingContext
Context used for applying a payload.
PayloadHandlingDisconnectException
Thrown to indicate that payload handling failed and that the client should be disconnected.
PayloadHandlingErrorException
Thrown to indicate that payload handling failed and that an error should be logged.
PayloadHandlingException
Exception thrown when a payload cannot be handled.
PayloadHandlingSilentException
Thrown to indicate that payload handling was canceled but that no action should be taken.
PayloadSender
Represents something capable of sending a payload to a receiver.
PlayChannel
A channel that can be used during the 'play' phase and that can be registered with a platform.
PlayChannelContext<C>
Describes something capable of supplying context to a channel.
PlayContextDecoder<C,P>
Used for decoding context from a payload.
PlayPayloadHandlingContext
Context used for applying a payload during the 'play' phase.
RegistryNetByteBuf
A NetByteBuf bound to a particular RegistryAccess instance.
RootPlayChannelContext<C,P>
A channel context that supplies a context object but has no parents.
SimpleChildPlayChannelContext<PARENT,CHILD>
Like a ChildPlayChannelContext, wrapping another channel context, extracting more detailed context from it.
